mosinstall.name: MosAuthorXTD
mosinstall.author: Thomas Kahl
mosinstall.description:
MosAuthorXTD 2.0 - Created by Thomas Kahl, 2006

This mambot creates individual author-, created- and hits string

Just publish the mambot. You don't need to add anything else. You should hide the mambo-standard-display options from the global settings.

If you want to place it in position AUTHOR, you have to activate the display of the author. If you don't want to display the original 'written by', you have to edit your active language-file and place an empty string in the definition of '_WRITTEN_BY'.

To override the global settings in this mambot, add the mambot to the content:
{mosauthorxtd /text:Text with placeholders /mail:0-1 /pos:1-4 /css:classname}.
Every parameter not set in the mambot, will be set with the global value.

The available Positions are:
1: First Line of Content
2: Last Line of Content
3: In Title
4: Replace original "Written-by"

Important: all link-features (sectionlink, categorylink and mailto) are only available in position 1 and 2

You can select for each position where to show it. Just select the dropdown for each block.

Available placeholders are:
#author# inserts author or alias-name (created)
#lastauthor# inserts author, alias-name or modified_by name new in 2.0
#authorcname# inserts name from Contacts new in 2.0
#authoremail# inserts email adress new in 2.0
#authorid# inserts authorID or blank, when alias
#authorregdate# registration date of the author (global date format) new in 2.0
#authorlastdate# last visit date of the author (global date format) new in 2.0
#authorposition# field "position" from contacts new in 2.0
#authorinfo# field "misc. info" from contacts new in 2.0
#authorimage# displays the image set in contacts new in 2.0
#created# created date
#modified# modified date
#modifiedname# modified by name new in 2.0
#hits# number of hits
#section# section-name
#sectionlink# link to section-blog
#category# category-name
#categorylink# link to category-blog
#usertype# inserts usertype of author

If you want to hide the string completely from an article, just add {mosauthorxtd noshow} to the article content.

Example:


Written by #author# at #created# (#hits# hits)

Important: all "Contact-Features" can only work if the author is "connected" to a contact! Otherwise the placeholders are replaced with an empty string!

Have Fun!
